text: Joosje Burg (born 29 July 1997) is a Dutch field hockey forward from Veghel. She plays with HC 's-Hertogenbosch and the Netherlands women's national field hockey team. ==Career== ===Club Hockey=== Burg plays with HC Den Bosch since 2015. ===Under-23 National Team=== Burg played with the national Under–21 team at the 2016 Women's Hockey Junior World Cup in Santiago, Chile. ===Senior National Team=== Burg was a reserve player during the 2020–21 Women's FIH Pro League and made her debut in the 2021–22 Women's FIH Pro League. She scored during the league several times. She was selected in the Netherlands squad for the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup, held in July 2022. ==Personal life== The father of Burg died in January 2019 from a fatal accident during a holiday in Thailand. ==References== Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:Dutch field hockey players Category:Sportswomen Category:Sportspeople from North Brabant Category:People from Meierijstad
title: Joosje Burg
